TopicTitle: How should KSP v1.0 play with these specs?

Articles.Content:
How should KSP v1.0 play with these specs? its not to bad so far actually in flight but in all the buildings (research,contracts) its lagging for some reason?

win 7 home premium

PROCESSOR: intel pentium cpu p6200 @2.13ghz

INSTALLED MEMORY (RAM): 3.00gb (2.37gb usable)

SYSTEM TYPE: 64 bit os.

intel hd graphics.

anything else needed to tell?

its an acer aspire laptop so its not the best for the job.

It may not run KSP at all, another member has had trouble with his Aspire, KSP would not run using the Intel graphics, and while he has an Nvidia card as well, KSP and Dxdiag refused to use it.

Other than that the specs look okay.

I play KSP 0.90 with modes on my pc OS: Windows 7 Service Pack 1 (6.1.7601) 64bitCPU: Intel® Celeron® CPU 420 @ 1.60GHz (1)

RAM: 2039 

GPU: Intel® 82945G Express Chipset Family (64MB)

 on minimal detals but 1.0 crash any parts is black and windows in all cockpit is black too.

sorry for my bad english ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Download the demo and try it if you're unsure about investing in it.

Demo is working very good, but in 1.0 any parts are black. I mean its a shader quality problem. Any low quality texture have a fix this problem. I have very bad and old computer but i plaing 0.90 with no problems (some-time game crash and i must restart PC, its normal for my old PC).

I have played 0.90 on a core 2 duo (3Ghz), 4GB ram, HD5870 without any problems; it ran really well. Also previous versions on HD5770 without any problem.

On a i3 laptop with HD3000, it battles but on minimum-ish graphics it runs OK enough that its fun to play. Think the intel graphics is the problem, it particularly seems to battle with terrain (as in space its is ok).
